channel.title: What are your comp's specs?
channel.description:
Might as well see who has the best specs. Feel free to post however much info as you please... here's mine: computer: 512 mb RAM Windows XP Home 80 gig hd 2.4 Ghz processor
laptop: 96 mb RAM Windows XP Pro + Linux + Windows 95 1.5 gig hd 133 Mhz processor I just love it how my laptop runs WinXP faster than my main computer...

item.title: What are your comp's specs?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Windows XP Home Edition
512MB of RAM
2.8GHZ processor, Intel
71.6GB Harddrive space
Radeon X300 Graphics card

NOTE: This is MY FIRST COMPUTER. I am happy with it(I can do the things I want, but alot of the time I want a new one. This computer serves my purposes well but we all want a little faster computer, don’t we? :)), I can play games(Mainly age of empires but lowest graphics else small lag, it dosen’t bother me. I play for the freaking strategy involved, not graphics). At the time I brought it, the price for it was good. I am thinking about upgrading my RAM, HD space, Graphics Card and an external HD but when I got money. If not I’ll buy a new computer.

Also, I’d like to note it’s a Dell. I NEVER crash unexpectedly, and when I do I take full responsibility. It’s often caused by having too much programs open, in other words, exceeding my RAM, and if that dosen’t lag too bad I stop, else I’m often waiting 2 minutes for it to restart.

Read full topic

item.title: What are your comp's specs?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

My Laptop:

Dell Inspiron 9300
OS: WinXP MCE + WinVista RC1/Kubuntu (switch between Vista and Kubuntu a lot).
HDD: 80 GB (formatted = 76 GB or so)
CPU: IPentium M 740 (1.73 GHz)
GPU: Ati MobilityRadeon X300 128MB (Soon upgrading to nVidia 6800 Go 256 MB)
Screen: 17" Widescreen with 1920x1200

Read full topic

item.title: What are your comp's specs?
item.dc:creator: @Aukake Aukake
item.description:
@Aukake wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:9, topic:13723”][quote author=leader link=topic=20456.msg231873#msg231873 date=1157886253]
The highest memory you can get at the moment is 2 gb, right?

Is there any site that tells you what are the best desktop specifications at this time,and updates when something improves?
[/quote]
Nope, I know someone who has 6 GB RAM. Know idea how to do it, though.

And you can get (expensive) servers with 64 GB+ RAM.[/quote]

I think he means per module. That’s the highest I’ve seen per module, 2gb… To my knowledge it’s possible to have 8gb in a desktop with decent mobo features.

My Desktop:

OS: Windows XP Pro
RAM: 1GB
HDD: 160 spec (formatted = 150)
GFX: Radeon X800xl (by HIS Hightech)
Processor: 3.0 GHZ Pentium 4

Had her for 3 years now. She holds up nicely.

Read full topic

item.title: What are your comp's specs?
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

[quote=“leader, post:3, topic:13723”]Desktop:
512 mb RAM
Windows XP Professional
80 GB HD
2.4 Ghz Processor

Laptop 1:
1 Gb memory
140 GB HD
Windows Professional
1.66 Ghz Processor

Laptop 2: Tablet
512 Mb Ram
Windows Tablet Edition
80 GB HD
1.66 Ghz Processor

I need to get a new computer. One that has 2 gb Ram, and 250 + Disk Space, although I only use like 6 gb’s. How do you know which Processor to get? Which one is the best?[/quote]
The best processor? Definitely the 486! Especially with a version of Windows Vista on it, if at all possible.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 10, 2006, 01:02:35 AM[/size][hr][quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:5, topic:13723”]i just buy extra ram… lol its alot cheaper… like i spent $80.00 on 1gb of memory[/quote]
…or you could buy an ownage laptop for DSL installation for about $70.00

item.title: What are your comp's specs?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

ima feel dirty for saying all this but…

2gb ram
xp home
300gb (they lied its only 280!) hdd
pentium d 930 (thats dual core 3ghz 64bit)
and a nvidia 7900gt

my brothers computer (which i used to use for ages)

768mb ram
xp home
40gb hdd
2.6ghz celeron
nvidia 5200 fx

ahaha if i knew my my ‘laptop’ is id be able to tell you exactly but i think its something like

32mb ram
win 98
600mb hdd
75mhz cpu (HOW FRICKEN UBER IS THAT!?)
… i just hope silab doesnt bust in and steal it

Read full topic
